Fetching Player Details

Source: vignettes/player-details.Rmd
player-details.Rmd

A special case of the fetch_ family of functions is the fetch_player_details_ set of functions. You can read the general explanation of how to use the main fetch functions on the Vignette. The player details functions accepts slightly different arguments.

Basic Usage

You can use fetch_player_details to return a list of player details for a given club and source. The source will determine exactly what details are returned. The default is the AFL.com.au website.

fetch_player_details("Hawthorn")
#> # A tibble: 42 × 17
#>    firstName surname     id team  season jumpe…¹ posit…² provi…³ dateO…⁴ draft…⁵
#>    <chr>     <chr>    <int> <chr>  <dbl>   <int> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>  
#>  1 Lachlan   Bramble   4313 Hawt…   2022      16 MEDIUM… CD_I10… 1998-0… 2020   
#>  2 Mitch     Lewis     1333 Hawt…   2022       2 KEY_FO… CD_I10… 1998-1… 2016   
#>  3 Max       Lynch     1319 Hawt…   2022      18 RUCK    CD_I10… 1998-0… 2021   
#>  4 Harry     Morrison  1341 Hawt…   2022       1 MIDFIE… CD_I10… 1998-1… 2016   
#>  5 Ned       Reeves    1822 Hawt…   2022      37 RUCK    CD_I10… 1998-1… 2018   
#>  6 James     Worpel    1713 Hawt…   2022       5 MIDFIE… CD_I10… 1999-0… 2017   
#>  7 Emerson   Jeka      3049 Hawt…   2022      39 KEY_FO… CD_I10… 2001-0… 2019   
#>  8 Jacob     Koschit…  1819 Hawt…   2022      23 KEY_FO… CD_I10… 2000-0… 2018   
#>  9 Dylan     Moore     1595 Hawt…   2022      13 MEDIUM… CD_I10… 1999-0… 2017   
#> 10 Conor     Nash      1302 Hawt…   2022      11 MIDFIE… CD_I10… 1998-0… 2016   
#> # … with 32 more rows, 7 more variables: heightInCm <int>, weightInKg <int>,
#> #   recruitedFrom <chr>, debutYear <chr>, draftType <chr>, draftPosition <chr>,
#> #   data_accessed <date>, and abbreviated variable names ¹​jumperNumber,
#> #   ²​position, ³​providerId, ⁴​dateOfBirth, ⁵​draftYear

The AFL website will return AFLW or AFLM data, while other sources only include AFLM data.

details_aflw <- fetch_player_details(team = "Western Bulldogs", current = TRUE, comp = "AFLW", source = "AFL")

head(details_aflw)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 15
#>   firstName surname     id team   season jumpe…¹ posit…² provi…³ dateO…⁴ heigh…⁵
#>   <chr>     <chr>    <int> <chr>   <dbl>   <int> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <int>
#> 1 Hannah    Scott     1502 Weste…   2022      22 MEDIUM… CD_I10… 1990-0…     168
#> 2 Ashleigh  Guest     1630 Weste…   2022      19 MEDIUM… CD_I10… 1990-0…     169
#> 3 Brooke    Lochland  1447 Weste…   2022       1 MEDIUM… CD_I10… 1991-0…     158
#> 4 Ellyse    Gamble    1445 Weste…   2022      14 RUCK    CD_I10… 1997-0…     180
#> 5 Bailey    Hunt      1649 Weste…   2022      21 MEDIUM… CD_I10… 1996-0…     171
#> 6 Kirsten   McLeod    1668 Weste…   2022       6 MEDIUM… CD_I10… 1994-0…     161
#> # … with 5 more variables: weightInKg <int>, recruitedFrom <chr>,
#> #   debutYear <chr>, draftType <chr>, data_accessed <date>, and abbreviated
#> #   variable names ¹​jumperNumber, ²​position, ³​providerId, ⁴​dateOfBirth,
#> #   ⁵​heightInCm

The list of details returned for AFL.com.au website is below.

glimpse(details_aflw)
#> Rows: 31
#> Columns: 15
#> $ firstName     <chr> "Hannah", "Ashleigh", "Brooke", "Ellyse", "Bailey", "Kir…
#> $ surname       <chr> "Scott", "Guest", "Lochland", "Gamble", "Hunt", "McLeod"…
#> $ id            <int> 1502, 1630, 1447, 1445, 1649, 1668, 2024, 2096, 2171, 21…
#> $ team          <chr> "Western Bulldogs", "Western Bulldogs", "Western Bulldog…
#> $ season        <dbl> 2022, 2022, 2022, 2022, 2022, 2022, 2022, 2022, 2022, 20…

The AFLTables.com source will return all players who have played for the specified team over time.

fetch_player_details("Hawthorn", source = "afltables")
#> # A tibble: 948 × 15
#>    Player   Team    Cap `#`   HT    WT    Games  Wins Draws Losses Goals Seasons
#>    <chr>    <chr> <dbl> <chr> <chr> <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <chr>  
#>  1 Paddy B… Hawt…     1 6     183cm "82k…    31     6     1     24    13 1925-1…
#>  2 Dave El… Hawt…     2 23    175cm "70k…     3     0     0      3     5 1925   
#>  3 Fred Fi… Hawt…     3 11    183cm "84k…    37     6     1     30    10 1925-1…
#>  4 Jack Gi… Hawt…     4 14    171cm ""       40     7     0     33     9 1925-1…
#>  5 Gil Hen… Hawt…     5 17    185cm "84k…    17     2     0     15     9 1925, …
#>  6 Jim Jac… Hawt…     6 1     174cm "73k…    22     4     1     17     1 1925-1…
#>  7 Jim McC… Hawt…     7 8     175cm "73k…    46     6     1     39     7 1925-1…
#>  8 Stan Mc… Hawt…     8 3     173cm "75k…    17     3     0     14    NA 1925   
#>  9 Cyril N… Hawt…     9 2     180cm "70k…    18     2     1     15     1 1925-1…
#> 10 Bert Of… Hawt…    10 21    182cm "80k…    12     2     0     10     6 1925   
#> # … with 938 more rows, and 3 more variables: Debut <chr>, Last <chr>,
#> #   date_accessed <date>

The Footywire.com source allows you to specify just the current list of players, which is fairly quick, or all players over time which can be a little slow.

fetch_player_details("Richmond", source = "footywire", current = TRUE)
#> # A tibble: 43 × 11
#>    No    surname  first_name Games Age      Date …¹ Height Weight Origin Posit…²
#>    <chr> <chr>    <chr>      <chr> <chr>    <chr>   <chr>  <chr>  <chr>  <chr>  
#>  1 16    Aarts    Jake       34    27yr 1m… 8 Dec … 177cm  76kg   Richm… Forward
#>  2 7     Baker    Liam       64    23yr 11… 27 Jan… 173cm  72kg   Subia… Defend…
#>  3 21    Balta    Noah       44    22yr 2m… 23 Oct… 194cm  102kg  Calde… Defend…
#>  4 41    Banks    Sam        0     18yr 9m… 2 Apr … 186cm  71kg   Tasma… Defend…
#>  5 29    Bolton   Shai       67    23yr 1m… 8 Dec … 175cm  77kg   South… Midfie…
#>  6 35    Broad    Nathan     84    28yr 8m… 15 Apr… 192cm  89kg   Swan … Defend…
#>  7 30    Brown    Tom        0     18yr 5m… 30 Jul… 186cm  77kg   Murra… Defend…
#>  8 22    Caddy    Josh       171   29yr 3m… 28 Sep… 186cm  87kg   North… Midfie…
#>  9 11    Castagna Jason      117   25yr 5m… 12 Jul… 182cm  82kg   North… Forward
#> 10 42    Clarke   Judson     0     18yr 2m… 17 Oct… 179cm  69kg   Dande… Midfie…
#> # … with 33 more rows, 1 more variable: Position_2 <chr>, and abbreviated
#> #   variable names ¹​`Date of Birth`, ²​Position_1

One challenge is that each source accepts different values for the team argument. There is a helper function that will return an error if the wrong team is supplied and provide a list of acceptable values for that specific source.

fetch_player_details("Greater Western Sydney", source = "afltables")
#> → For the afltables source, details are returned for all seasons. Ignoring `current` argument
#> ℹ Fetching player details for Greater Western Sydney
#> Error in `team_check_afltables()`:
#> ! Greater Western Sydney is not a valid input for afltables teams.
#> Should be one of Adelaide, Brisbane Lions, Brisbane Bears, Carlton, Collingwood, Essendon, Fitzroy, Fremantle, GWS, Geelong, Gold Coast, Hawthorn, Melbourne, North Melbourne, Kangaroos, Port Adelaide, Richmond, St Kilda, Sydney, South Melbourne, West Coast, University, Western Bulldogs, Footscray
#> ✖ Fetching player details for Greater Western Sydney ... failed
#>
